definition[0]: if something you can see or hear recedes, it gets further and further away until it disappears
definition[1]: if a memory, feeling, or possibility recedes, it gradually goes away
example[1]: The pain in his head gradually receded.
definition[2]: if water recedes, it moves back from an area that it was covering
example[2]: The flood waters finally began to recede in November.
definition[3]: if your hair recedes, you gradually lose the hair at the front of your head
example[3]: He was in his mid-forties, with a receding hairline.
definition[4]: if prices, interest rates etc recede, they decrease
example[4]: Growth was expected to recede throughout the year.
